inventory.commentary: Does not include pronominal uses, only nominal ones

sense.name: a quantity of zero
sense.examples: The bill for dinner came to almost nothing. (a bit figurative) The fuel gauge is reading nothing, we'd better find a gas station. Five minus five leaves nothing.

sense.name: nonexistence, a non-existent thing
sense.examples: Heidegger's philosophical question was why is there something rather than nothing. Those accusations turned out to be nothing. (no true state of affairs corresponded to them)

sense.name: insignificant value or worth
sense.examples: The man felt like a big nothing. Sally considers their line of cosmetics to be nothing. She seems to get upset over nothing. (events or situations of trivial significance)
